transportAdvice: Nice has an efficient tram network and bus system that connects the main tourist areas, including the seafront, old town, and airport. The city centre and Promenade des Anglais are very walkable, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cool and mild by Mediterranean standards, with occasional rain and crisp sunny days between showers.
Still cool but with increasing sunshine, making it pleasant for sightseeing without summer crowds.
Spring begins to arrive with warming temperatures and a mix of sunny spells and occasional showers.
Mild and increasingly sunny, ideal for outdoor exploration with comfortable daytime temperatures.
Warm and largely sunny with low rainfall, making it one of the best months to visit.
Hot and sunny with very little rain; beach season is well underway and the city is lively.
Peak summer heat with long sunny days, minimal rain, and the busiest tourist season.
Equally hot as July with crowded beaches and a vibrant atmosphere along the promenade.
Warm and still very pleasant, with crowds thinning and the sea remaining warm for swimming.
Mild autumn temperatures with more frequent rain, but still many comfortable sunny days.
Noticeably cooler with increased rainfall, though mild compared to most of Europe in November.
Cool and quiet with a festive atmosphere in the city, occasional rain, and crisp clear days.
